intro: Frasera nitida var. albicaulis, commonly known as the white-stemmed frasera, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its slender, often white-veined stems. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
